casebody.data:
Dennison Manufacturing Co. v. White. Replevin. Under the defendant’s objection, a witness testified what amount of goods the plaintiffs’ books showed had been sold by the plaintiffs to one Baker. The books not being duly authenticated, and a verdict being returned for the plaintiffs, a new trial was granted. iSulloway, Topliff O’ Connor and W J. Copeland, for the plaintiffs. II. U. Burnham, N. U. Wilson, and Briggs Sp Huse, for the defendant.

[Hillsborough,

June, 1884.]
